Feedback

components.content:
We welcome your views on the registration service.

If you agree to be contacted by answering 'yes' below, you will be consenting to share your personal data – name, email address, telephone number and service received – with our independent partner research agency, IFF research.

You may withdraw your consent at any stage by email Consular.research@fco.gov.uk.

For more details on how your data will be handled in relation to feedback please see the research privacy policy at www.gov.uk/fco/tell-fco.

pages.title: Getting married in Spain

components.content: ! Warning Apply for all your certificates at least 3 months before you take your documents to the civil registry appointment.

The civil registry office will ask for one or both of the following:

  • Certificate of no impediment
  • Marital status certificate
Print out both sample forms and take them with you when you first visit the civil registry office. They will tell you which forms you need.

If your partner is British they’ll need to make a separate application to the consulate with the same certificates. If they’re not British they’ll need equivalent documents from their local authorities.
Add a photo of the main page of your UK passport – the page with the passport photo.

components.title: How to photograph your document
components.content:
• Lay it flat on a table or for better results against a wall.
  • Make sure your address is readable.
  • No flash if possible.
  • Position the phone parallel to the document.
  • Use both hands to keep your phone steady.

components.name: needMSC
components.title: Do you need a marital status certificate?

pages.title: Apply for a certificate of no impediment and marital status certificate

components.content:
To get married in Spain you need to get a certificate of no impediment (‘capacidad matrimonial’) and a marital status certificate.

A certificate of no impediment:

  • costs £50
  • takes 28 days to process
  • is valid for 6 months

A marital status certificate:

  • costs £50
  • takes 30 days to process

Apply for all your certificates at least 3 months before you take your documents to the civil registry appointment.

Have the following information ready before you apply:

  • name of authority in Spain (civil registry, court etc.) requesting the certificate from the British Consulate
  • date of appointment to submit paperwork to the authority in Spain. (approximate date)
  • date and place of the ceremony

pages.title: Find out if you need a certificate of no impediment

components.content:
You need to visit the civil registry office where you're planning to get married to find out which documents you need before you can apply.

If you don't do this you might apply and pay for a certificate you don't need.

pages.title: Find out if you need a marital status certificate

components.content:
You need to visit the civil registry office where you're planning to get married to find out which documents you need before you can apply.

Without doing this, you risk applying and paying for a certificate you don't need.
This service is for getting a certificate of no impediment or marital status certificate.

pages.title: Civil partnership is not recognised in Spain

components.content: You won't be able to plan your civil partnership ceremony in Spain.
Same sex marriage is recognised if you would still like to plan a ceremony in Spain.

pages.title: Apply for a certificate of no impediment (‘capacidad matrimonial’)

components.content:
To get married in Spain you need to get a certificate of no impediment (‘capacidad matrimonial’).

A certificate of no impediment:

  • costs £50
  • takes 28 days to process
  • is valid for 6 months

Apply for your certificate at least 3 months before you take your document to the civil registry appointment.

Have the following information ready before you apply:

  • name of authority in Spain (civil registry, court etc.) requesting the certificate from the British Consulate
  • date of appointment to submit paperwork to the authority in Spain. (approximate date)
  • date and place of the ceremony

pages.title: Apply for the marital status certificate

components.content:
To get married in Spain you need to get a marital status certificate.

A marital status certificate:

  • costs £50
  • takes 30 days to process

Apply for your certificate at least 3 months before you take your document to the civil registry appointment.

Have the following information ready before you apply:

  • name of authority in Spain (civil registry, court etc.) requesting the certificate from the British Consulate
  • date of appointment to submit paperwork to the authority in Spain. (approximate date)
  • date and place of the ceremony

pages.title: Proof of address where you're staying in Spain
What you'll need to apply

components.content: You'll need to upload the following documents before you start your application:

components.title: Which documents can be used as proof of address?
components.content:
• electoral roll confirmation letter
  • utility bills (not printed off the internet) / building society/savings bank passbook
  • bank/building society/credit card statement (not ones printed off the internet)
  • mortgage statement /council tax demand / credit reference agency search
  • recent evidence of entitlement to state or local authority-funded benefit, tax credit, pension, educational or other grant
components.name: /need-to-apply-other-country-MSC-partner-married-953-953

components.content:
You can either scan your documents or take photos on your mobile phone.

You may find it easier to take photos on your phone then send them to the device you are using for your application.

components.title: How to get a notice of marriage
components.content:
To get a Spanish CNI you need to make an appointment at your local registry office to give notice of your marriage.
This costs £35 and takes 28 days.
You'll need to sign and swear the affirmation and notice of marriage in front of a local notary in Spain
You'll need to sign and swear the affirmations and notice of marriage in front of a local notary in Spain
You'll need to sign and swear the affirmation in front of a local notary in Spain

declaration:
I understand and accept that it is my responsibility to ensure that any document provided as a result of this Consular service is acceptable to the requesting authority and that if the document is to be presented outside of the UK or Spain, the signature of the Consular officer will be recognised by the requesting authority. Refunds cannot be given where the incorrect service is requested.

I request the British Consulate in Madrid accept receipt of my Certificate of No Impediment application by post/courier and that my certificate and any original documents will be returned to me by courier.

I understand and accept that if my application is sent back to me for any reason, I will be charged for postage. In doing so, I fully understand and accept that the Foreign and Commonwealth Office assumes no legal or other responsibility for any loss, damage or misplacement of the said property whilst in transit to or from the British Consulate in Madrid.

I declare that the particulars given above are true to the best of my personal knowledge and belief.
